title: Interest Rate Swap Fixed Leg
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the present value of the fixed leg of an interest rate swap. PV_fixed represents the present value
column5: N is the notional principal
column6: R_fixed is the fixed rate
column7: delta_i is the day count fraction for period i
column8: and DF_i is the discount factor for period i. The fixed leg pays a constant rate throughout the swap's life.

title: Interest Rate Swap Floating Leg
main_category: i * delta_i * DF_i)
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
column5: This equation calculates the present value of the floating leg of an interest rate swap. PV_float represents the present value
column6: N is the notional principal
column7: R_float
column8: i is the floating rate for period i (typically LIBOR or SOFR)
column9: delta_i is the day count fraction
column10: and DF_i is the discount factor.

title: Swap Value at Inception
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the value of a swap at inception. V_swap represents the swap value
column5: which is the difference between the present value of the fixed leg and the present value of the floating leg. At inception
column6: the swap rate is set so that V_swap = 0.

title: Par Swap Rate
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the par swap rate (the fixed rate that makes the swap value zero at inception). R_swap represents the par swap rate
column5: DF_n is the discount factor for the final maturity
column6: and the denominator is the sum of weighted discount factors. The par swap rate is the market-quoted rate for swaps.

title: Swap Value After Inception
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the value of an existing swap. V_swap represents the current swap value
column5: which changes as interest rates move. If rates rise
column6: the fixed leg becomes more valuable (positive value for the fixed-rate payer). The swap value is marked to market regularly.

title: Swap DV01
equation_latex: DV01_swap = sum_{i=1}^n (delta_i * DF_i * N) - sum_{i=1}^n (delta_i * DF_i * N)
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the DV01 (dollar value of a 01 basis point change) of a swap. DV01_swap represents the sensitivity of the swap value to a 1 bp change in rates. For a par swap
column5: the DV01 is approximately the duration-weighted notional amount.

title: Swap Duration
equation_latex: D_swap = (sum_{i=1}^n t_i * delta_i * DF_i) / (sum_{i=1}^n delta_i * DF_i)
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the duration of a swap. D_swap represents the swap duration
column5: t_i is the time to payment i
column6: delta_i is the day count fraction
column7: and DF_i is the discount factor. Swap duration is important for managing interest rate risk in swap portfolios.

title: Swap Convexity
equation_latex: Conv_swap = (sum_{i=1}^n t_i^2 * delta_i * DF_i) / (sum_{i=1}^n delta_i * DF_i)
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the convexity of a swap. Conv_swap represents the swap convexity
column5: which measures the curvature of the swap value with respect to interest rate changes. Convexity is important for accurate risk management
column6: especially for large rate movements.

title: Forward Rate Agreement Payoff
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a Forward Rate Agreement (FRA). Payoff represents the FRA payoff
column5: N is the notional
column6: FRA_rate is the agreed rate
column7: L is the realized LIBOR rate
column8: delta is the day count fraction
column9: and DF is the discount factor. FRAs are forward contracts on interest rates and are building blocks for swaps.

title: Swap Spread
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the swap spread. Spread represents the difference between the swap rate and the treasury rate of the same maturity. The swap spread reflects credit risk and liquidity differences between the swap market and the treasury market.

title: Cross-Currency Swap
main_category: i)
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
column5: This equation calculates the present value of the domestic leg of a cross-currency swap. PV_domestic represents the present value in domestic currency
column6: N_domestic is the domestic notional
column7: R_domestic is the domestic rate
column8: and DF_domestic
column9: i are domestic discount factors. Cross-currency swaps involve exchanging payments in different currencies.

title: Cross-Currency Swap FX Leg
equation_latex: PV_foreign = X_0 * sum_{i=1}^n (N_foreign * R_foreign * delta_i * DF_foreign
main_category: i)
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
column5: This equation calculates the present value of the foreign leg converted to domestic currency. PV_foreign represents the present value in domestic currency
column6: X_0 is the current spot exchange rate
column7: N_foreign is the foreign notional
column8: R_foreign is the foreign rate
column9: and DF_foreign
column10: i are foreign discount factors.

title: Cross-Currency Swap Value
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the value of a cross-currency swap. V_ccs represents the swap value
column5: which is the difference between the domestic leg value and the foreign leg value (converted to domestic currency). Cross-currency swaps are used to hedge currency risk.

title: Asset Swap
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the asset swap spread. Spread represents the spread that makes the bond price equal to par when combined with an interest rate swap. Asset swaps are used to convert fixed-rate bonds to floating-rate exposure.

title: Total Return Swap
equation_latex: Payoff = (Bond Return + Coupon - LIBOR - Spread) * N
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a total return swap. Payoff represents the periodic payment
column5: Bond Return is the price appreciation of the reference bond
column6: Coupon is the coupon payment
column7: LIBOR is the floating rate
column8: Spread is the agreed spread
column9: and N is the notional. TRS transfers total economic exposure.

title: Inflation Swap
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation gives the payoff of an inflation swap. Payoff represents the periodic payment
column5: N is the notional
column6: Inflation_index is the realized inflation rate
column7: Fixed_rate is the agreed fixed rate
column8: and delta is the day count fraction. Inflation swaps are used to hedge inflation risk.

title: Amortizing Swap
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the present value of an amortizing swap. PV represents the present value
column5: N_i is the declining notional at period i
column6: R is the swap rate
column7: delta_i is the day count fraction
column8: and DF_i is the discount factor. Amortizing swaps have declining notional amounts over time.

title: Accreting Swap
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the present value of an accreting swap. PV represents the present value
column5: N_i is the increasing notional at period i
column6: R is the swap rate
column7: delta_i is the day count fraction
column8: and DF_i is the discount factor. Accreting swaps have increasing notional amounts over time.

title: Forward Swap Rate
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation calculates the forward swap rate for a swap starting at time t and ending at time T. F_swap represents the forward swap rate
column5: DF_t and DF_T are discount factors for times t and T
column6: and the sum is over the swap period. Forward swap rates are used for pricing delayed-start swaps.

title: Caplet Payoff
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
column5: This equation gives the payoff of a caplet (a single-period cap). Payoff represents the caplet payoff
column6: N is the notional
column7: delta is the day count fraction
column8: L is the realized LIBOR rate
column9: and K is the cap rate. Caplets are European options on interest rates and are building blocks for caps.

title: Cap Price
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
notes: This equation calculates the price of a cap as the sum of caplet prices. C represents the cap price
column5: and Caplet_i is the price of the i-th caplet. A cap is a portfolio of caplets
column6: each covering a different period.

title: Caplet Price (Black Model)
equation_latex: Caplet = N * delta * DF * [F * N(d_1) - K * N(d_2)]
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
notes: This equation prices a caplet using the Black model. Caplet represents the caplet price
column5: N is the notional
column6: delta is the day count fraction
column7: DF is the discount factor
column8: F is the forward rate
column9: K is the strike rate
column10: and N(d) is the cumulative normal distribution. The Black model assumes lognormal forward rates.

title: Black Model d_1
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
notes: This equation defines the d_1 parameter in the Black model for interest rate options. d_1 combines the moneyness (ln(F/K))
column5: volatility sigma
column6: and time to expiration T. The Black model is the standard for pricing European interest rate options.

title: Black Model d_2
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
notes: This equation defines the d_2 parameter in the Black model. d_2 is simply d_1 minus sigma * sqrt(T). d_2 represents the probability that the option will be in the money under the forward measure.

title: Floorlet Payoff
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
column5: This equation gives the payoff of a floorlet (a single-period floor). Payoff represents the floorlet payoff
column6: N is the notional
column7: delta is the day count fraction
column8: L is the realized LIBOR rate
column9: and K is the floor rate. Floors protect against falling interest rates.

title: Floor Price
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
notes: This equation calculates the price of a floor as the sum of floorlet prices. F represents the floor price
column5: and Floorlet_i is the price of the i-th floorlet. A floor is a portfolio of floorlets
column6: each covering a different period.

title: Collar Price
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
notes: This equation calculates the price of a collar. Collar represents the collar price
column5: which is the difference between buying a cap and selling a floor. Collars limit interest rate exposure to a range between the floor rate and cap rate.

title: Swaption Payoff (Payer)
main_category: 0) * sum_{i=1}^n delta_i * DF_i
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

column6: R_swap is the swap rate at expiration
column7: K is the strike rate
column8: delta_i are day count fractions
column9: and DF_i are discount factors. A payer swaption gives the right to enter a pay-fixed swap.

title: Swaption Price (Black Model)

main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

column6: R_swap is the forward swap rate
column7: K is the strike rate
column8: and the sum is the annuity factor. Swaptions are options on interest rate swaps.

title: Receiver Swaption Payoff

column6: R_swap is the swap rate at expiration
column7: K is the strike rate
column8: delta_i are day count fractions
column9: and DF_i are discount factors. A receiver swaption gives the right to enter a receive-fixed swap.

title: Bond Option Payoff (Call)
notes: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
column5: This equation gives the payoff of a European call option on a bond. Payoff represents the option payoff
column6: B_T is the bond price at option expiration
column7: and K is the strike price. Bond options are options on fixed income securities.

title: Bond Option Price (Black Model)
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options

column5: DF is the discount factor to option expiration
column6: F is the forward bond price
column7: K is the strike price
column8: and N(d) is the cumulative normal distribution.

title: Callable Bond Pricing
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Options
notes: This equation prices a callable bond. B represents the callable bond price
column5: B_noncallable is the price of an equivalent non-callable bond
column6: and C_option is the value of the embedded call option. Callable bonds give the issuer the right to redeem the bond early.

title: Puttable Bond Pricing

column5: B_nonputtable is the price of an equivalent non-puttable bond
column6: and P_option is the value of the embedded put option. Puttable bonds give the holder the right to sell the bond back to the issuer.

title: Convexity Adjustment
notes: T_n)^2 * sigma_S^2 * T
column5: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps

title: Inflation Swap Price
equation_latex: P = sum_{i=1}^n (N * R_fixed * delta_i * DF_i) - sum_{i=1}^n (N * I_i * delta_i * DF_i)
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation prices an inflation swap. P represents the swap price
column5: N is the notional
column6: R_fixed is the fixed rate
column7: I_i are the realized inflation rates
column8: delta_i are day count fractions
column9: and DF_i are discount factors. Inflation swaps exchange fixed payments for inflation-linked payments.

title: Yield Curve Steepener Trade

notes: This equation gives the payoff of a yield curve steepener trade. Payoff represents the trade payoff
column5: y_long and y_short are the long and short yields
column6: Duration is the portfolio duration
column7: and DV01 is the dollar duration. Steepener trades profit from increasing yield curve slope.

title: Yield Curve Flattener Trade
main_category: Fixed Income Derivatives - Interest Rate Swaps
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a yield curve flattener trade. Payoff represents the trade payoff
